text: A revelation about Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenges. Yahweh avenges and is full of wrath. Yahweh takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh is slow to anger, and great in power, and will by no means leave the guilty unpunished. Yahweh has his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rebukes the sea and makes it dry, and dries up all the rivers. Bashan and Carmel languish. The flower of Lebanon languishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains quake before him, and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, yes, the world, and all who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can stand before his indignation? Who can endure the fierceness of his anger? His wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken apart by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those who take refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with an overflowing flood, he will make a full end of her place, and will pursue his enemies into darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: What do you plot against Yahweh? He will make a full end. Affliction won’t rise up the second time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For entangled like thorns, and drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly like dry stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text: One has gone out of you who devises evil against Yahweh, who counsels wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh says: “Though they are in full strength and likewise many, even so they will be cut down and pass away. Though I have afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I will break his yoke from off you, and will burst your bonds apart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh has commanded concerning you: “No more descendants will bear your name. Out of the house of your gods, I will cut off the engraved image and the molten image. I will make your grave, for you are vile.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace! Keep your feasts, Judah! Perform your vows, for the wicked one will no more pass through you. He is utterly cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who dashes in pieces has come up against you. Keep the fortress! Watch the way! Strengthen your waist! Fortify your power mightily!
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh restores the excellency of Jacob as the excellency of Israel, for the destroyers have destroyed them and ruined their vine branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shield of his mighty men is made red. The valiant men are in scarlet. The chariots flash with steel in the day of his preparation, and the pine spears are brandished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chariots rage in the streets. They rush back and forth in the wide ways. Their appearance is like torches. They run like the lightnings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He summons his picked troops. They stumble on their way. They dash to its wall, and the protective shield is put in place.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gates of the rivers are opened, and the palace is dissolved.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is decreed: she is uncovered, she is carried away; and her servants moan as with the voice of doves, beating on their breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nineveh has been from of old like a pool of water, yet they flee away. “Stop! Stop!” they cry, but no one looks back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the plunder of silver. Take the plunder of gold, for there is no end of treasure, an abundance of every precious thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: She is empty, void, and waste. The heart melts, the knees knock together, their bodies and faces have grown pale.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the den of the lions, and the feeding place of the young lions, where the lion and the lioness walked with the lion’s cubs, and no one made them afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs, and strangled prey for his lionesses, and filled his caves with the kill and his dens with prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, I am against you,” says Yahweh of Armies, “and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword will devour your young lions; and I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers will no longer be heard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery—no end to the prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The noise of the whip, the noise of the rattling of wheels, prancing horses, and bounding chariots,
speaker: Narrator

text: the horseman charging, and the flashing sword, the glittering spear, and a multitude of slain, and a great heap of corpses, and there is no end of the bodies. They stumble on their bodies
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the multitude of the prostitution of the alluring prostitute, the mistress of witchcraft, who sells nations through her prostitution, and families through her witchcraft.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, I am against you,” says Yahweh of Armies, “and I will lift your skirts over your face. I will show the nations your nakedness, and the kingdoms your shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will throw abominable filth on you and make you vile, and will make you a spectacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will happen that all those who look at you will flee from you, and say, ‘Nineveh is laid waste! Who will mourn for her?’ Where will I seek comforters for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Are you better than No-Amon, who was situated among the rivers, who had the waters around her, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was of the sea?
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength. Put and Libya were her helpers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet was she carried away. She went into captivity. Her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets, and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also will be drunken. You will be hidden. You also will seek a stronghold because of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: All your fortresses will be like fig trees with the first-ripe figs. If they are shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, your troops among you are women. The gates of your land are set wide open to your enemies. The fire has devoured your bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw water for the siege. Strengthen your fortresses. Go into the clay, and tread the mortar. Make the brick kiln strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: There the fire will devour you. The sword will cut you off. It will devour you like the grasshopper. Multiply like grasshoppers. Multiply like the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of the skies. The grasshopper strips and flees away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your guards are like the locusts, and your officials like the swarms of locusts, which settle on the walls on a cold day, but when the sun appears, they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your shepherds slumber, king of Assyria. Your nobles lie down. Your people are scattered on the mountains, and there is no one to gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no healing your wound, for your injury is fatal. All who hear the report of you clap their hands over you, for who hasn’t felt your endless cruelty?
speaker: Narrator
